intro: Leucas hagghierensis, commonly known as the Hagghier's leucas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of purple or blue. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
